pddl4j.exp
Class WhenExp

java.lang.Object
  pddl4j.exp.AbstractExp
      pddl4j.exp.WhenExp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Exp
public class WhenExp
extends AbstractExp

This class implements a conditional expression of the PDDL language.

See Also:
Serialized Form

          Creates a new conditional expression.

apply

public WhenExp apply(Substitution sigma)
Substitutes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression and that are mapped in the substitution by its binding term.

Parameters:
sigma - the substitution.
Returns:
a substituted copy of this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if sigma == null.

standardize

public WhenExp standardize()
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.
See Also:
Exp.standardize()

standardize

public WhenExp standardize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> images)
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. The map argument is used to store the variable already standardized. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Parameters:
images - the object that maps old variable images to the standardize image.
Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if images == null.
See Also:
Exp.standardize(Map)

Returns true if the expression is ground.

Returns:
true if the expression is ground; falseotherwise.
See Also:
Exp.isGround()

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if this conditional expression is equal to an other object, i.e., if the object is a not null reference to an instance of the class WhenExp and both conditional expressions have the same condition and effect.

Specified by:
equals in interface Exp
Overrides:
equals in class AbstractExp
Parameters:
obj - The reference object with which to compare.
Returns:
true if this conditional expression is equal to an other object; false otherwise.

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns a hash code value for the conditional expression. This method is supported for the benefit of hash tables such as those provided by java.util.Hashtable.

Specified by:

normalize

public WhenExp normalize()
Normalize this when expression. The condition is converted into disjunctive normal form and effect in conjunctive normal form.

Returns:
a normalize copy of this when expression.
